block.comment:
This block (Bluetooth setup block) tells the Arduino we are using Bluetooth devices.
A pin is a piece of metal connected to the Arduino used to control or sense electricity.
Below ---- is where you can set values that the virtual circuit will take in.
This block tells the Arduino which pin to use for each color. RGB stands for red, green, and blue. By combining colors, you can make other colors.

This block (Bluetooth setup block) tells the Arduino we are using Bluetooth devices.
A pin is a piece of metal connected to the Arduino used to control or sense electricity.
Below ---- is where you can set values that the virtual circuit will take in.

The loop block runs on repeat until your Arduino loses power. It runs right after your setup block if you have one.
If you are using the simulator, you can control how many times it repeats.
Releases the button on the only simulation.

"If blocks" will run the code in the Then section if what is inside the If what is attached to IF Section equals true. If you connected the is_button_pressed block to the IF Section and the button is pressed, then the then section’s code will run.
Checks if the state of the defined pin is HIGH
This block pauses the Arduino for x number of seconds. Nothing will be able to be sensed while the delay is running.
Releases the button on the only simulation.
Releases the button on the only simulation.
